Hi Ken,

On 19/12/2007, Kenneth Stanley <kstanley@...> wrote:

> Colin, I just wanted to second that I believe the GUI stuff is quite
> important for the reasons you stated. They really help you
> understand what's going on and thereby debug and better optimize
> parameters.

And more importantly it looks cool :)  Which actually is quite a good
way of getting people interested.

>
> Also, SharpNEAT is one of the fastest versions of NEAT available.
> The regression experiments can run 100,000 generations in a few
> hours, which is impressive. Will the same optimizations that allow
> that performance really hold after transferring it over?

I can't say categorically that it would but from what I know there is
no reason that it shouldn't. The performance is largely due to
platform agnsotic optimsations, e.g. using a hashtable in place of a
loop searching for an item in a list, or keeping items (genes etc)
sorted to speed up crossover, etc.

Colin.
